citation.article-title: Pseudomonas composti sp. nov., isolated from compost samples
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudomonas composti sp. nov.
Pseudomonas composti (com.pos′ti. N.L. n. compostum -i compost; N.L. gen. n. composti of compost, from which strains were first isolated).
The description is based on two strains.
Gram-negative and non-spore-forming rods (0.4–0.5 µm wide and 1.5–2 µm long).
Catalase- and oxidase-positive, strictly aerobic and motile by a single polar flagellum.
Colonies on Columbia blood agar are circular, creamy, brilliant and non-haemolytic.
Colonies on LB agar are round, yellow and smooth with irregular edges (1.5–2 mm in diameter).
Fluorescent pigment is not produced on King’s B medium.
Does not reduce nitrate or nitrite and is negative for arginine dihydrolase, indole production, β-galactosidase and acid production from glucose.
Does not hydrolyse gelatin, urea or aesculin.

With API 50 CH and API 20 NE, assimilates d-glucose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, caprate, l-malate, citrate, glycerol, d-fructose, d-arabitol and gluconate, but not N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, erythritol, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, l-xylose, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin, salicin, cellobiose, lactose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, starch, d-adonitol, glycogen, xylitol, gentiobiose, turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, l-arabitol, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, d-galactose, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, maltose, adipate or phenylacetate.

With API ZYM, positive for ester lipase (C8), esterase (C4) (weakly), trypsin (type strain weakly), leucine arylamidase, alkaline phosphatase, acid phosphatase (type strain weakly) and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase (type strain weakly); all other tests are negative.
The major cellular fatty acids are a summed feature (C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH), C18 : 1ω7c/12t/9t, C16 : 0 and C12 : 0.
The type strain, C2T ( = CECT 7516T = CCUG 59231T), was isolated from a compost sample.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 61.5 mol%.
